floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.
River levels are remaining high in the area, but have fallen below the flood alert level.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert/warning if necessary.
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
River levels are falling steadily, but remain high on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water due to recent heavy rainfall and will remain so for several days.
Areas most at risk include The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water. River levels also remain high at the Keswick Campsite; Lodore gauge.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 9:00am on 24/09/2023, or as the situation changes.

River and lake levels continue to fall but remain high on the River Greta, River Derwent, Derwent Water lake level.
Areas most at risk include low lying areas bordering the shores of Derwent Water and the frontage of the Keswick Camping and Caravan Club Site.
River levels also remain high at the Lodore gauge.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 9:00am on 24/09/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.message: This Flood Alert has been removed. River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
